messages.message: Hey all! Does anyone know what version of opensearch (or elasticsearch? assuming it's opensearch) we use in production for AI Hub saas? I can't for the life of me figure that out. It's either v1.x or v2.11 judging by our test suite.

From a sandbox with opensearch:
```[opensearch@statefulset-opensearch-cluster-0 ~]$ curl localhost:9200
{
  "name" : "statefulset-opensearch-cluster-0",
  "cluster_name" : "opensearch-cluster",
  "cluster_uuid" : "I6fyYuisSOy0wuiAxmXp9A",
  "version" : {
    "distribution" : "opensearch",
    "number" : "2.19.2",
    "build_type" : "tar",
    "build_hash" : "e0ba5eebfa3f060fc76e4e2b5b61193a19470d4f",
    "build_date" : "2025-04-29T20:06:33.471315233Z",
    "build_snapshot" : false,
    "lucene_version" : "9.12.1",
    "minimum_wire_compatibility_version" : "7.10.0",
    "minimum_index_compatibility_version" : "7.0.0"
  },
  "tagline" : "The OpenSearch Project: https://opensearch.org/"
}```
We don't use opensearch in AIhub MT.

I have the same result with Jacky.

I did a Docker pull of the  latest OpenSearch:25.26.0-aihub locally and ran

`opensearch --version`

```[opensearch@399af32175c5 ~]$ opensearch --version
WARNING: Using incubator modules: jdk.incubator.vector
WARNING: A terminally deprecated method in java.lang.System has been called
WARNING: System::setSecurityManager has been called by org.opensearch.bootstrap.OpenSearch (file:/usr/share/opensearch/lib/opensearch-2.19.2.jar)
WARNING: Please consider reporting this to the maintainers of org.opensearch.bootstrap.OpenSearch
WARNING: System::setSecurityManager will be removed in a future release
Version: 2.19.2, Build: tar/e0ba5eebfa3f060fc76e4e2b5b61193a19470d4f/2025-04-29T20:06:33.471315233Z, JVM: 21.0.6```

https://console.instabase.com/customer/Fannie%20Mae/tenant/fanniemae/info

I checked the recent deploy AIHUB environment , fanniemae, the version is also 2.19.2

aihub prod uses aws managed opensearch
version is 1.3
